title: Textile, 1700–05
medium:
Medium: silk, metal-wrapped silk
Technique: satin damask with discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade)
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 110 x 54 cm (43 5/16 x 21 1/4 in.)
creditline: Museum Purchase from Au Panier Fleuri and Smithsonian Institution Collections Acquisition Program Funds
description: Bizarre-style silk of pale blue damask brocaded with red silk floss and silver metallic yarns, in feather-like shapes and floral scrolls.

exhibitions.title: Nancy and Edwin Marks Collection Gallery: Treasures from the Collection

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 1700–05.
1700–05. Medium: silk, metal-wrapped silk
Technique: satin damask with discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade). Museum Purchase from Au Panier Fleuri and Smithsonian Institution Collections Acquisition Program Funds. 2000-23-1.
